critical_lines: Superposition wasn't a theory for him. It was Tuesday night.
I miss feeling like me. Singular. Whole. Not distributed.
I see every road. I walk all of them simultaneously. And it's paralyzing, Sarah.
This Marcus—this one is real. And this one's choices mean something to me.
Two types of isolation, finding strange comfort in each other's presence.
I'm glad you woke up. From the cardiac arrest. I'm glad you're here.
Different from collapsed consciousness. Not better, not worse. Just different.
Maybe that's all consciousness is. Loneliness in various forms.
You get the mercy of uncertainty about roads not taken. I see every road.
And something, Marcus was learning, was enough.
